actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term for President and Vice President, and to repeal the twenty-second article amendment to the Constitution.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - States that the President and Vice President shall hold a six year term of office. Prohibits election more than once for either office. Prohibits a person elected to the Office of President from being subsequently elected to the Office of Vice President. Repeals the twenty-second amendment to the Constitution.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to provide for a single six-year term for President and Vice President, and to repeal the twenty-second article amendment to the Constitution.
